title: ID font from papermag and Base-nine alternative
content:
I’m looking for something like this. The G looks a bit like Base-9, but everything else is way off. I have an idea, that I’ve seen the font before, but nothing pops up in my mind.

See it here: [http://www.papermag.com/modules/archive/uploaded\_images/1307\_ct\_kal\_penn...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/www.papermag.com/modules/archive/uploaded_images/1307_ct_kal_penn.jpg "http://www.papermag.com/modules/archive/uploaded\_images/1307\_ct\_kal\_penn.jpg")

or

[http://www.papermag.com/images/comingsoon.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/www.papermag.com/images/comingsoon.gif "http://www.papermag.com/images/comingsoon.gif")

Regarding Base-9 (and base-12) I must say I really like the font, when all letters are capitalized, but I don’t quite like it, when it’s lower case. I feel the the upper-cases coould be put together with something else. Something similar but without the pointy/sharp ends. Any ideas on how an alternative lowercase base-nine could look (and what the name of that font would be)?

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [basenine.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/typophile.com/files/basenine.jpg) | 58.49 KB |

 [‹ Italic font in Hungarian linguistics publications](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/typophile.com/node/19764 "Go to previous forum topic") [typography on stone or monument ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/typophile.com/node/19780 "Go to next forum topic")
author: peter_monrad

comments.content: That’s [Eagle](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FB.605.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=KALIFORNIA+DREAMING&sampleSize=24), the best known digitisation being the [Font Bureau](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023003753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Font%252BBureau) version.
